voicesplitting.gui

Class NoteDisplayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • voicesplitting.gui.NoteDisplayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class NoteDisplayer
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A NoteDisplayer is the JPanel that is able to display MidiNotes graphically.

    It handles voice solos, note highlights, and note right click actions from the MidiNoteGUIPopupMenu class.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 17 June, 2015
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Constant Field Values

      • columnHeader

        private javax.swing.JPanel columnHeader
        The column header to use for the JScrollPane, saved as a field so we can just repaint it from this class.

      • rowHeader

        private javax.swing.JPanel rowHeader
        The row header to use for the JScrollPane, saved as a field so we can just repaint it from this class.

      • horizontalScale

        private int horizontalScale
        The horizontal scale of this GUI object. Note times will be divided by this amount to get layout location. Default is 10000.

      • verticalScale

        private int verticalScale
        The vertical scale of this GUI object. Note pitches will be multiplied by this amount to get layout location. Default is 10.

      • lastOffset

        private long lastOffset
        The offset tick of the last MidiNote in the currently loaded MIDI.

      • voices

        private boolean voices
        Whether this is displaying voices or not.

        A Set of the currently highlighted notes.

        private MidiNoteGUI lastClicked
        The most recently clicked note.

      • hasHighlightedNotes

        public boolean hasHighlightedNotes()
        Return whether we have highlighted notes or not.
        Returns:
        True if we have highlighted notes. False otherwise.

      • toggleHighlight

        public void toggleHighlight(MidiNoteGUI note)
        Toggle the highlighting of the given note.
        Parameters:
        note - The note whose highlighting we want to toggle.

      • changeHighlightedChannels

        public void changeHighlightedChannels(int channel)
        Change the channel of the highlighted notes to the given value.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel we want to change the notes to.

      • highlightAllBetween

        public void highlightAllBetween(MidiNoteGUI note1,
                       MidiNoteGUI note2)
        Highlight all notes between the given 2 notes, inclusive. That is, all notes whose onsets and pitches are between or equal to those of either of the 2 notes.
        Parameters:
        note1 - The first boundary
        note2 - The second boundary

      • deleteHighlightedNotes

        public void deleteHighlightedNotes()
        Delete all of the currently highlighted notes.

      • isHighlighted

        public boolean isHighlighted(MidiNoteGUI note)
        Return if the given note is highlighted or not.
        Parameters:
        note - The note we are checking if it is highlighted.
        Returns:
        True if the given note is highlighted. False otherwise.

      • toggleSolo

        public void toggleSolo(int channel)
        Toggle the soloing of the given channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - The index of the channel to solo.

      • clearAllSolos

        public void clearAllSolos()
        Clear all soloed channels. That is, make all notes visible.

      • isSoloed

        public boolean isSoloed(int channel)
        Return if the given channel is soloed or not.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel we want to check.
        Returns:
        True if the channel is currently soloed. False otherwise.

      • splitHighlightedNotes

        public void splitHighlightedNotes()
        Split the selected notes. This must be run when the only curently highlighted notes are exactly 2 that overlap. The split method simply switches the onset times of the 2 notes.

      • canSplit

        public boolean canSplit()
        Decide if we can split the currently highlighted notes or not. We can split if and only if there are exactly 2 notes highlighted and they overlap.
        Returns:
        True if we can split. False otherwise.
